title: New Holland Mhdrescher | Combine Harvester | Free to use 4K footage - creative commons

subtasks: Arrive at the planting area.
Drive the tractor towards the field.
Adjust the seed drill attachment to be properly placed in front of the tractor.
Start the tractor engine.
Attach the seed drill to the tractor.
Check the seed drill settings (e.g., depth, spacing) for optimal planting.
Make sure the seed hopper is filled with the appropriate seeds.
Check that the tractor is in the correct driving position for planting.
Begin driving the tractor through the field.
Monitor the seeder to ensure proper seed placement and proper backfill covering the seeds.
Starting the farm tractor at the beginning of the workday.
Performing regular maintenance on the tractor (e.g., oil changes, checking tire pressure, fluid levels).
Attaching various implements to the tractor for different farming operations (e.g., plow, harrow, mower).
Operating the tractor to transport farm equipment and supplies to the field.
Preparing the equipment (e.g., seed drill, fertilizer spreader) before attaching to the tractor.
Ensuring the equipment is properly connected to the tractor's drawbar or other attachment points.
Securing implements (if necessary) to prevent them from coming loose during operation.
Verifying the depth and spacing of the seed drill is set according to the plan.
Adjusting the settings as needed to correct any deviations from the desired planting parameters.
Ensuring all attachments are operating correctly (e.g., seed spreader's mechanism, fill tube for refilling the hopper).

tasks.task: Ensuring safety while driving the tractor.
subtasks: Wearing appropriate safety gear (e.g., seatbelt, safety glasses, reflective clothing) while operating the tractor.
Checking the tractor's safety equipment (e.g., roll-over protection structure, emergency brakes) before operation.
Observing the terrain and adjusting the tractor's speed or equipment settings to manage slope or uneven areas.
Checking for any obstructions on the field that could interfere with equipment operation or planting.
Storing unused seeds or other supplies in their proper containers or locations.
Removing any empty seed packets or packaging from the planting area.
Noting the number of acres or rows planted, seed rates, and other relevant data for farm records.
Locating the nearest fuel supply for the farm's fuel tanks.
Preparing the fueling equipment (if needed) and ensuring proper connection to the tractor.
Refueling the tractor's fuel tank, ensuring not to overfill.
Properly storing any fuel containers and disposing of any excess fuel safely.
